WorkItem.ClosedComment:
As part of our move to GitHub, we're closing our CodePlex suggestions and asking that people move them to the GitHub issue tracker for further discussion.  Some feature requests may already be active on GitHub, so please make sure to look for an existing issue before filing a new one.

You can find our GitHub issue tracker here:
https://github.com/microsoft/typeScript/issues
WorkItem.Description:
Currently, typescript assumes that modules are namespaced.

For example,

An exported class defined at "/my/module" called MyModule

import myModule = module("my/module"); 

would need to be accessed by myModule.MyModule

In dojo, the AMD modules aren't namespaced, but typescript prevents you from accessing "myModule" as if it were a class or an interface.

In order to fix this, either:
a) Allow developers to cast the module variable immediately to a predefined interface
b) Allow syntax that specifies that the imported module isn't namespaced


Likewise, we require the ability to export a class or module without namespacing it internally. This ensures that mixins can gracefully happen between dojo and typescript files.
WorkItem.Summary: Add ability to import AMD modules that aren't namespaced

Comments.Message: @neville1355 - I believe this is the same issue as in http://typescript.codeplex.com/workitem/47.  If the proposal there for "export =" style support in modules does not address the scenario you have in mind here, could you share a concrete example?
